item.title: Computational Science and Engineering (CSE) for carbon capture, storage, and utilization (CCUS)
item.description: Application of data science and scientific computing techniques for the analysis of CCUS technologies.

item.title: Dynamic Mode Decomposition of Large-Scale Aerodynamic Simulations of Base-Bleed Projectiles
item.description: This study applies Dynamic Mode Decomposition to analyze and reduce CFD data of base-bleed military projectiles, identifying dominant dynamic modes of the velocity field from 2D axisymmetric simulations.

item.title: Application of Scientific Machine Learning Techniques for Fluid Dynamics Analysis
item.description: Application of machine learning techniques, informed by governing physical laws, for fluid dynamics analysis.

item.title: Modal Analysis of Fluid Dynamics
item.description: Application of the Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD) technique to identify and understand coherent structures (or modes) that dominate the spatial and temporal behavior of a fluid flow.

item.title: Statistical Process Control
item.description: Application of Statistical Process Control to analyze the dimensions and quality of products in a manufacturing environment.

item.title: Numerical Methods for Simulating Transport Phenomena
item.description: Application of the numerical method of lines (NUMOL) to solve the classical problem of one-dimensional heat transfer in a cylinder.

item.title: Machine Learning Application for Weld Quality Characterization
item.description: Study of dynamic resistance curve patterns resulting from spot weld quality levels.

item.title: Digital Transformation and Indicator Management
item.description: Use of Microsoft Power Platform tools to digitize activities and manage manufacturing indicators (production, maintenance, engineering, people, safety, quality, etc.).

item.title: Application of Optimization Techniques in Industrial Environments
item.description: Application of the ant colony optimization algorithm for scheduling items in assembly lines.

item.title: GAWPS: A MRST-based module for wellbore proﬁling and graphical analysis of ﬂow units
item.description: GAWPS is a collection of computational routines intended to carry out wellbore profiling for flow unit detection in reservoir models. This acronym stands for Graphical Analysis for Well Placement Strategy.

item.title: Graphical Methods for Delineating Flow Units in Oil Reservoirs: Concepts and Applications
item.description: This paper (preprint) reviews key graphical methods for petrophysical analysis aimed at identifying and classifying flow units in reservoirs.

item.title: Numerical Modeling and Characterization of Oil Reservoirs
item.description: Computational representation of the physical and geological characteristics of oil wells.

item.title: Assessment of Flow Indices and Field Sectoring for Strategic Oil Well Placement and Production
item.description: This work investigates optimal well placement in a 3D heterogeneous reservoir by comparing different location strategies based on flow zone indicators (FZI and FZI*).

item.title: Flight Dynamics Analysis and Control Surface Design
item.description: Study and optimization of an aircraft’s motion and stability through the design of aerodynamic control surfaces.

item.title: 3D Modeling and Technical Drawings of Mechanical Systems
item.description: Creation of three-dimensional representations and detailed technical drawings of mechanical systems, aiming to design, analyze, and manufacture components with precision.

item.title: Experience
item.description:
Professional

Moura Group

It is the market leader in South America. Since 1957, in the city of Belo Jardim, Pernambuco, it has fulfilled the dream of visionary entrepreneurs Edson Mororó Moura and his wife, Conceição Moura. Initially focused on the automotive sector, the company has expanded its operations to other segments, now producing batteries and energy storage systems for a wide range of applications, such as motorcycles, boats, forklifts, uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), subways, trains, telephone stations, storage systems, among others.

item.description:
Laboratories

  • TRIL Lab’s proposal lies on a conceptual triad which is the reason for its name: SEIZE, SHAPE, and SOLVE. This holistic “3S” model intends to deploy a portfolio of solutions for strategic sectors of our economy and society. Our focus is computational science and engineering (CSE).

Tools

  • The MATLAB Reservoir Simulation Toolbox (MRST) is a free open-source software for reservoir modelling and simulation, developed primarily by the Applied Computational Science group in the Department of Mathematics and Cybernetics at SINTEF Digital.
